question: [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/ray_math.move] [Constants] [WAD_RAY_RATIO] Is the WAD_RAY_RATIO = 1e9 constant at line 12 correctly used in all conversions, or are there places where the ratio is hardcoded differently causing inconsistency? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/ray_math.move] [Constants] [HALF_WAD Calculation] Is HALF_WAD = WAD/2 at line 7 always equal to 5e17 precisely, or can integer division introduce unexpected values affecting all wad rounding? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/ray_math.move] [Constants] [HALF_RAY Calculation] Is HALF_RAY = RAY/2 at line 10 precisely 5e26, and could integer division in the constant definition introduce rounding errors affecting all ray operations? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/ray_math.move] [Error Codes] [Error Code Collision] Do the error codes RAY_MATH_MULTIPLICATION_OVERFLOW (1101), RAY_MATH_ADDITION_OVERFLOW (1102), and RAY_MATH_DIVISION_BY_ZERO (1103) at lines 15-17 conflict with error codes from other modules? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/ray_math.move] [Function: All] [address::max() Usage] Why is address::max() used instead of u256::max() in overflow checks at lines 49, 62, 76, 89, and does this introduce platform-specific vulnerabilities? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/ray_math.move] [Function: wad_mul()] [Vault Share Calculation] When vault deposit logic uses wad_mul to calculate shares from deposited amounts, can rounding errors allow depositors to receive more shares than they should? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/ray_math.move] [Function: wad_div()] [Share Price] If vault share price is calculated using wad_div(total_value, total_shares), can edge cases with very small share counts cause incorrect pricing? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/ray_math.move] [Function: ray_mul()] [Interest Accrual] When LST interest rates are applied using ray_mul, can rounding errors in favor of users drain the protocol over many epochs? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/ray_math.move] [Function: ray_div()] [APY Calculation] If APY or interest rate calculations use ray_div, can attackers manipulate inputs to cause overflow or extreme results breaking rate limits? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/ray_math.move] [Function: ray_to_wad()] [Oracle Price Conversion] When oracle prices in ray precision are converted to wad for vault valuation, can precision loss cause assets to be systematically undervalued or overvalued? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/ray_math.move] [Function: wad_to_ray()] [Fee Calculation] When wad-denominated fees are converted to ray for interest calculations, can conversion overflow or precision loss allow fee bypass? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/ray_math.move] [Function: wad_mul()] [Fee Application] If protocol fees (e.g., 0.3% = 3e15 wad) are applied via wad_mul, can very small transaction amounts result in zero fees due to rounding? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/ray_math.move] [Function: wad_div()] [Slippage Check] When expected_shares is calculated via wad_div and compared against actual shares, can rounding allow slippage bypass? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/ray_math.move] [Function: ray_mul()] [Boosted Rewards] If boosted balance rewards use ray_mul for multiplier application, can rounding enable users to claim more rewards than entitled? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/ray_math.move] [Function: Multiple] [Loss Tolerance] When vault loss tolerance checks compare ray-precision values after operations, can rounding differences cause false positives or false negatives? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/ray_math.move] [Function: wad_mul()] [Sandwich Attack] Can an attacker exploit rounding in wad_mul by sandwiching their transaction between operations that manipulate share price, extracting value from rounding errors? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/ray_math.move] [Function: wad_div()] [Flash Loan Attack] Using a flash loan to manipulate vault total value, can an attacker exploit wad_div rounding to mint shares at favorable prices then immediately withdraw? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/ray_math.move] [Function: ray_mul()] [Epoch Boundary] At epoch boundaries when interest is applied via ray_mul, can an attacker time their operations to benefit from rounding before the epoch update? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/ray_math.move] [Function: ray_to_wad()] [Oracle Manipulation] Can an attacker manipulate oracle prices such that ray_to_wad conversion produces favorable rounding for their vault positions? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/ray_math.move] [Function: wad_mul()] [Dust Attack] By depositing dust amounts where wad_mul rounds to zero shares, can an attacker drain vault value without receiving shares? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/ray_math.move] [Function: wad_div()] [Minimum Deposit] Can the minimum deposit amount be bypassed by exploiting wad_div rounding to mint shares from sub-minimum deposits? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/ray_math.move] [Function: Multiple] [Griefing] Can an attacker repeatedly perform operations that maximize rounding errors against other users, griefing them even without direct profit? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/ray_math.move] [Function: ray_mul() + ray_div()] [Interest Rate Manipulation] Can an attacker manipulate interest rate calculations by exploiting compound rounding in chains of ray_mul and ray_div operations? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/ray_math.move] [Function: wad_mul()] [Boundary Value] When a or b equals exactly WAD (representing 1.0), does wad_mul return exactly the other parameter or does rounding introduce error? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/math/sources/ray_math.move] [Function: ray_mul()] [Unit Value] When a or b equals RAY (1.0 in ray), does ray_mul preserve the other value exactly, or does HALF_RAY rounding cause deviation? (Low)
